channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report I-2024100120
item.description:
Report I-2024100120

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: Richland
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Call came in at 12:47 AM Shipment had arrived at JCK and was damaged due to pallet collapsing under its on weight. Hazmat One was called at 12:59 AM. The Dock associates were ask to wait off the dock until the clean up crew were done due to the fumes(4 hours). The Hazmat crew arrived at 3:00 AM, they discovered 33 1-Gal jugs were leaking. They were finished at 5:30 AM 2-55 GAL drums of damaged jugs and 2- overpacks full of good jugs were left on-site until disposal can be authorized.

item.title: Report E-2024100398
item.description:
Report E-2024100398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: GILBERT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BARNES OIL AND PROPANE INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On October 15th 2024 between the hours of 13:00 and 14:00 the driver loaded 7,500 gallons of clear diesel fuel into truck number 60, trailer number 139 at the Kinder Morgan fuel Terminal in North Augusta, SC. The driver left Kinder Morgan headed towards Columbia on I-20 and got off the interstate on exit 22 which is HWY #1. The driver traveled down #1 Hwy until he got to Chinquapin Road in Monetta and turned right. Chinquapin Rd turned into Two Notch Road which is in Leesville SC. The driver made a right turn onto Pond Branch and proceeded towards exit 44. The driver came over the bridge slowing down so that he would be able to make the turn. The driver stated he didnâ€™t feel like he was speeding making the turn, but he never looked at the speedometer. The driver made his turn, and the truck proceeded to lay over on its side. The Lexington County Fire Service responded to the scene. The rollover resulted in approximately 1500 gallons of ULSD being released on to the ground. The spilt fuel was recovered/remediated by Republic Services. The remaining product was pumped from the rolled over trailer to a trailer brought on scene by Barnes Oil & Propane Representatives.

HAZ-SPILL line was called. The reference number for the report is 219696.

item.title: Report E-2024080689
item.description:
Report E-2024080689

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T00:56:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: Granite City
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIR PRODUCTS AND CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 2230pm on Monday July 29, 2024 a driver had begun to load a Liquid Nitrogen Trailer. As the driver struck the knuckle, the tail piece broke clean off and sprayed the driver's leg with Liquid Nitrogen. The driver had all proper PPE on and evacuated the area. The pull away eventually shut down the loading process and the assistant operator closed the top and bottom fill valves.
